014package org.jdbi.v3.core.statement;
015
016/**
017 * Parses the named parameters out of an SQL statement, and returns the
018 * {@link ParsedSql} containing the JDBC-ready SQL statement, along with the
019 * type of parameters used (named or positional), the number, and the parameter
020 * name for each position (if applicable).
021 */
022public interface SqlParser {
023    /**
024     * Parses the given SQL statement, and returns the {@link ParsedSql}
025     * for the statement.
026     *
027     * @param sql The SQL statement to parse
028     * @param ctx The statement context for the statement being executed
029     * @return the parsed SQL representing the SQL statement itself along with
030     * information about the parameters which should be bound (number and names)
031     */
032    ParsedSql parse(String sql, StatementContext ctx);
033
034    /**
035     * Convert rawName to a name as recognized by this parser
036     *
037     * @param rawName the raw name to transform
038     * @param ctx The statement context for the statement being executed
039     * @return a name appropriate for being identified a a named parameter by this parser
040     */
041    String nameParameter(String rawName, StatementContext ctx);
042}
